2:
"I have heard many such things;\q you are all miserable comforters.
\q
3:
Will useless words ever have an end?\q What is wrong with you that you answer like this?


\q
4:
I also could speak as you do,\q if you were in my place;
\q I could collect and join words together against you
\q and shake my head at you in mockery.
\q
5:
I would strengthen you with my mouth,\q and the quivering of my lips will bring you relief!


\q
6:
If I speak, my grief is not lessened;\q if I keep from speaking, how am I helped?
\q
7:
But now, God, you have made me weary;\q you have made all my family desolate.
\q
8:
You have made me dry up, which itself is a witness against me;\q the leanness of my body rises up against me,
\q and it testifies against my face.


\q
11:
God hands me over to ungodly people,\q and throws me into the hands of wicked people.
\q
14:
He smashes through my wall again and again;\q he runs upon me like a warrior.


\q
15:
I have sewn sackcloth on my skin;\q I have thrust my horn into the ground.
\q
16:
My face is red with weeping;\q on my eyelids is the shadow of death
\q
17:
although there is no violence in my hands,\q and my prayer is pure.


\q
18:
Earth, do not cover up my blood;\q let my cry have no resting place.
\q
19:
Even now, see, my witness is in heaven;\q he who vouches for me is on high.


\q
20:
My friends scoff at me,\q but my eye pours out tears to God.
\q
21:
I ask for that witness in heaven to argue for this man with God\q as a man does with his neighbor!
\q
22: For when a few years have passed,\q I will go to a place from where I will not return.
